reasoning_of_region: The problem involves comparing two samples of gas represented by diagrams, where each colored ball represents a gas particle. The task is to compare the average kinetic energies and temperatures of the samples based on the visual representation.
problem_understanding: The problem requires comparing the average kinetic energies and temperatures of two gas samples shown in diagrams, where each colored ball represents a gas particle.

known.name: number of particles
known.note: Both samples have the same number of particles.

unknown: average kinetic energy of sample A
average kinetic energy of sample B
relations: Average kinetic energy is related to temperature.
constraints: The containers are identical, closed, and rigid.

options.label: A
options.text: neither; the samples have the same temperature

reasoning_of_task: The task is to visually compare the diagrams to determine which sample has a higher temperature based on the average kinetic energy of the particles.
problem_summary: Compare the average kinetic energies and temperatures of two gas samples shown in diagrams.

knowns.name: number of particles
knowns.note: Both samples have the same number of particles.

asks: Which sample has the higher temperature?
constraints: The containers are identical, closed, and rigid.
visual_facts: Each colored ball represents one gas particle.
The diagram shows two samples labeled as Sample A and Sample B.
ambiguity: The problem does not specify the type of gas or the initial conditions of the samples.
